translations: adv.（与法律等）相抵触，有冲突，卷入纠缠地

phrs.translation: 碰撞，同某物撞在一起；和某人发生冲突

sentences.sentence: All of them had run afoul of the law at some time or other.
It would have run afoul of Jupiter and been chucked into interstellar space.
sentences.translation: 他可能与木星运行相冲突并被抛到了星际空间。

sentences.sentence: What's more, he added, every year that he and Tsukamoto go looking, they seem to run afoul of the elements.
sentences.translation: 更重要的是，他补充道，每年他和塜本去找鳗鱼，似乎都要遭遇恶劣天气。
